alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 18 at 3:48PM MST until August 18 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Graham County in southeastern Arizona... Northwestern Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 347 PM MST, a dust channel was near Dragoon, or 14 miles southwest of Willcox, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 300 and 353. Route 80 between mile markers 293 and 300. Route 90 between mile markers 290 and 297. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 341. Route 191 between mile markers 56 and 89. Locations impacted include... Benson, Willcox, St. David, Dragoon, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Cochise and Texas Canyon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
